citeinfo.origin: New York (N.Y.). Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications.
New York City Office of Technology and Innovation

pubinfo.publish: Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications

citeinfo.title: New York City Points of Interest, 2016

descript.abstract: New York City Points of Interest, 2016 is a point theme representing points of interest in New York City as of 2016. Point of Interest (aka Common Place) are point representations of locations that can be referred to by name and may or may not have an address. The data is a compilation of a variety of agency data and is a component of the CSCL database. Columbia Libraries staff downloaded this dataset from NYC Open Data at https://data.cityofnewyork.us/City-Government/Points-Of-Interest/rxuy-2muj and reformatted to the geopackage format in September of 2023. Additional information about the data may be found at https://github.com/CityOfNewYork/nyc-geo-metadata/blob/master/Metadata/Metadata_PointsOfInterest.md
descript.purpose: Use of the data is for analytic and cartographic purposes.

cntorgp.cntorg: NYC Office of Technology and Innovation

attr.attrdef: Point is assigned the closest roadbed SegmentID.
Point is assigned a ComplexID if it is a part of a Complex.
Point is assigned a SAFTYPE if it is a part of a Complex N = NAP assigned to a Stand-alone feature G = Complex NAP X = Constituent NAP
Indicates which side of the street the CommonPlace is on.
The unique identifier for each CommonPlace point. Links to the point to the FeatureName table.

Facility Domains are valid values for each FACILITY_TYPE:
Residential 1 = Gated Development 2 = Private Development 3 = Public Housing Development 4 = Constituent 5 = Other
Education Facility 1 = Public Elementary School 2 = Public Junior High-Intermediate-Middle 3 = Public High School 4 = Private/Parochial Elementary School 5 = Private/Parochial Junior/Middle School 6 = Private/Parochial High School 7 = Post Secondary Degree Granting Institution 8 = Other 9 = Public Early Childhood 10 = Public K-8 11 = Public K-12 all grades 12 = Public Secondary School 13 = Public School Building 14 = Public School Annex 15 = Private/Parochial Early Childhood 16 = Private/Parochial K-8 17 = Private/Parochial K-12 all grades 18 = Private/Parochial Secondary School
Cultural Facility 1 = Center 2 = Library 3 = Theater/Concert Hall 4 = Museum 5 = Other
Recreational Facility 1 = Park 2 = Amusement Park 3 = Golf Course 4 = Beach 5 = Botanical Garden 6 = Zoo 7 = Recreational Center 8 = Sports 9 = Playground 10 = Other 11 = Pool 12 = Garden
Social Services 1 = Residential Child Care 2 = Day Care Center 3 = Adult Day Care 4 = Nursing Home/Assisted Living Facility 5 = Homeless shelter 6 = Other
Transportation Facility 1 = Bus Terminal 2 = Ferry landing/terminal 3 = Transit/Maintenance Yard 4 = Airport 5 = Heliport 6 = Marina 7 = Pier 8 = Bridge 9 = Tunnel 10 = Exit/Entrance 11 = Water Navigation 12 = Other
Commercial 1 = Center 2 = Business 3 = Market 4 = Hotel/Motel 5 = Restaurant 6 = Other
Government Facility (non public safety) 1 = Government Office 2 = Court of law 3 = Post Office 4 = Consulate 5 = Embassy 6 = Military 7 = Other
Religious Institution 1 Church 2 Synagogue 3 Temple 4 Convent/Monastery 5 Mosque 6 Other
Health Services 1 = Hospital 2 = Inpatient care center 3 = Outpatient care center/Clinic 4 = Other
Public Safety 1 = NYPD Precinct 2 = NYPD Checkpoint 3 = FDNY Ladder Company 4 = FDNY Battalion 5 = Correctional Facility 6 = FDNY Engine Company 7 = FDNY Special Unit 8 = FDNY Division 9 = FDNY Squad 10 = NYPD Other 11 = Other 12 = FDNY Other
Water 1 = Island 2 = River 3 = Lake 4 = Stream 5 = Other 6 = Pond
Miscellaneous 1 = Official Landmark 2 = Point of Interest 3 = Cemetery/Morgue 4 = Other
BIN is an abbreviation of Building Identification Number. Point is assigned a BIN if it falls within a building.
Numeric codes for NYC 5 boroughs. 1 = Manhattan 2 = Bronx 3 = Brooklyn 4 = Queens 5 = Staten Island

This is a SubType field organizing the CommonPlace points into categories and sets up the domain values for the FACILITY_DOMAINS field. 1 = Residential 2 = Education Facility 3 = Cultural Facility 4 = Recreational Facility 5 = Social Services 6 = Transportation Facility 7 = Commercial 8 = Government Facility (non public safety) 9 = Religious Institution 10 = Health Services 11 = Public Safety 12 = Water 13 = Miscellaneous

Agency that defined the CommonPlace location. DoITT = Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications EMS = Fire Department Emergency Services (EMS) FDNY = Fire Department (Fire) DOB = Department of Buildings DOF = Department of Finance DOT = Department of Transportation DCP = Department of City Planning OEM = Office of Emergency Management 311 = 3-1-1 NYPD = Police Department OTHER = Other DPR = Department of Parks and Recreation NOAA = National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration NYCHA = New York City Housing Authority OSM = Open Street Map DOE = NYC Dept. of Education
The Street Code assigned to a CommonPlace .
The Addresspoint ID if the CommonPlace is related to any Addresspoint
The name of the CommonPlace. Most name come from Feature name table.
